sen.j: 弥生時代（やよいじだい）は、北海道・沖縄諸島を除く日本列島における時代区分の一つである。
sen.e: Yayoi period is one of periodization in the Japanese Archipelago excluding Hokkaido and Okinawa Islands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yayoi period is one of periodizations in the Japanese Archipelago excluding Hokkaido and Okinawa Islands.
Yayoi period is one of periodizations in the Japanese Archipelago excluding Hokkaido and Okinawa Islands.

sen.j: 縄文時代に後続し、古墳時代に先行する。
sen.e: Yayoi period follows Jomon period and precedes Kofun period (tumulus period).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Yayoi period follows the Jomon period and precedes the Kofun period (tumulus period).
The Yayoi period follows the Jomon period and precedes the Kofun period (tumulus period).

sen.j: およそ紀元前10世紀中頃（ただしこの年代には異論もある）から3世紀中頃までにあたる時代の名称である。
sen.e: It is the period approximately between the middle of the tenth century B.C. (though there are some objection to this date) to the middle of the third century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is the period approximately between the middle of the tenth century B.C. (though there are some objections to this date) to the middle of the third century.
It is the period approximately between the middle of the 10th century B.C. (though there are some objections to this date) to the middle of the 3rd century.
sen.cmt: tenth→10th,third→3rd と修正しました。（用語統一：その他「31項」に従い）

sen.j: 具体的には、稲作技術導入によって日本での水稲耕作が開始された時代である。
sen.e: In specific term, it is the period when a paddy-rice cultivations started in Japan by introduction of rice cropping techniques.
In specific terms, it is the period when rice-paddy cultivation started in Japan by introduction rice cropping techniques.
In specific terms, it is the period when rice-paddy cultivation started in Japan by introduction rice cropping techniques.

sen.j: 弥生時代は、水稲耕作による稲作の技術をもつ集団が列島外から北部九州に移住することによって始まった。
sen.e: Yayoi period had started as a group of people with the paddy-rice cultivation techniques immigrated from outside the Japanese Archipelago to the northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Yayoi period started when a group of people with rice-paddy cultivation techniques immigrated from outside the Japanese Archipelago to northern Kyushu.
The Yayoi period started when a group of people with rice-paddy cultivation techniques immigrated from outside the Japanese Archipelago to northern Kyushu.

sen.j: （しかし、1994年、縄文末期に属する岡山県総社市の南溝手遺跡（みなみみぞていせき）の土器片中からプラント・オパール（イネ科植物の葉などの細胞成分）が発見された。）
sen.e: (However, in 1994, plant opals (cell components (from leaves etc) of gramineous plants) were found inside the fragments of earthware from Minamimizote site located in Soja City, Okayama Prefecture, which was classified as a site from the end of Jomon period.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (However, in 1994, plant opals or cell components, from leaves, etc., of gramineous plants were found inside the fragments of earthware from the Minamimizote site located in Soja City, Okayama Prefecture, which was classified as a site from the end of the Jomon period.)

(However, in 1994, plant opals or cell components, from leaves, etc., of gramineous plants were found inside the fragments of earthware from the Minamimizote site located in Soja City, Okayama Prefecture, which was classified as a site from the end of the Jomon period.)

sen.j: （さらに同県真庭市美甘（みかも）姫笹原の4500年前の土器にもプラントオパールが発表された。）
sen.e: (Moreover, plant opals were also found from earthware of 4500 years ago from Himesasahara site in Mikamo, Maniwa City, Okayama Prefecture.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「姫笹原」とありますが、前文（元同文）とのつながりから、「姫笹原遺跡」を指すものととり、そのように訳しました。
sen.e: (Moreover, plant opals were also found from earthware of 4,500 years ago from the Himesasahara site in Mikamo, Maniwa City, Okayama Prefecture.)
(Moreover, plant opals were also found from earthware of 4,500 years ago from the Himesasahara site in Mikamo, Maniwa City, Okayama Prefecture.)

sen.j: (2005年には岡山県灘崎町の縄文時代前期（約6000年前）の地層から大量のプラントオパールが見つかり、少なくとも約3500年前からすでに陸稲（熱帯ジャポニカ米）による稲作が行われていたとする学説が数多く発表された。）
sen.e: (In 2005, large amounts of plant opals were found from a stratum of the early Jomon period (approximately 6000 years ago) in Nadasaki-cho, Okayama Prefecture, and many theories stating that the rice cultivation with a rice plant grown in a dry field (tropical Japonica rice) was practiced at least from 3500 years ago, were proposed.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (In 2005, large amounts of plant opals were found from a stratum of the early Jomon period, approximately 6,000 years ago, in Nadasaki-cho, Okayama Prefecture, and many theories stating that rice cultivation with a rice plant grown in a dry field (tropical Japonica rice) was practiced at least from 3,500 years ago, were proposed.)

(In 2005, large amounts of plant opals were found from a stratum of the early Jomon period [approximately 6,000 years ago], in Nadasaki-cho, Okayama Prefecture, and many theories stating that rice cultivation with a rice plant grown in a dry field [tropical Japonica rice] was practiced at least from 3,500 years ago, were proposed.)
sen.cmt: カッコを補い、また、カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。

sen.j: (また水稲である温帯ジャポニカについても縄文晩期には導入されていたともいわれ、現在では弥生時代のはじまりと定義される稲作開始時期自体が確定できない状態である。）
sen.e: (Also it is said that temperate Japonica rice, a paddy-rice plant, had already been introduced at the end of Jomon period and the starting time of rice cultivation, which is defined as the beginning of Yayoi period, cannot be confirmed at the moment.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (Also it is said that temperate Japonica rice, a paddy-rice plant, had already been introduced at the end of the Jomon period and the starting time of rice cultivation, defined as the beginning of the Yayoi period, cannot be confirmed at the moment.)

(Also it is said that temperate Japonica rice, a paddy-rice plant, had already been introduced at the end of the Jomon period and the starting time of rice cultivation, defined as the beginning of the Yayoi period, cannot be confirmed at the moment.)

sen.j: 「弥生」という名称は、1884年（明治17年）に東京府本郷向ヶ岡弥生町（現在の東京都文京区弥生 (文京区)）の貝塚で発見された土器が発見地に因み弥生式土器と呼ばれたことに由来する（なお、その後の都市化の進展などもあって正確な発見地は特定できなくなっている）。
sen.e: The name 'Yayoi' derived from Yayoi earthware, which was named after the place of discovery, as it was earthwares found at shell mounds in Yayoi-cho, Mukougaoka, Hongo, Tokyo Prefecture (Present Yayoi, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo) in 1884 (precise location of discovery cannot be identified because of the later urbanization increase.)

The name 'Yayoi' is derived from Yayoi earthware, named after the place of discovery, as it was earthware found at shell mounds in Yayoi-cho, Mukougaoka, Hongo, Tokyo Prefecture (Present Yayoi, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo) in 1884 (precise location of discovery cannot be identified because of the later increase in urbanization.)

The name 'Yayoi' is derived from Yayoi earthware, named after the place of discovery, as it was earthware found at shell mounds in Yayoi-cho, Mukogaoka, Hongo, Tokyo Prefecture (present Yayoi, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo) in 1884 (Precise location of discovery cannot be identified because of the later increase in urbanization.)
sen.cmt: Mukougaoka→Mukogaoka と修正しました。Present→present,precise→Precise と修正しました。

sen.j: 当初は、弥生式土器の使われた時代ということで「弥生式時代」と呼ばれ、その後徐々に「式」を省略する呼称が一般的となった。
sen.e: At first it was called 'Yayoi-shiki period', implying a period that used Yayoi earthware but later '-shiki' was omitted gradually and the name Yayoi became the general term.
At first it was called 'Yayoi-shiki period', implying a period that used Yayoi earthware but later '-shiki' was gradually omitted and the name Yayoi became the general term.
At first it was called 'Yayoi-shiki period,' implying a period that used Yayoi earthware but later '-shiki' was gradually omitted and the name Yayoi became the general term.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: なお余談だが、弥生時代の名称の起源となった、弥生町で出土した一群の土器は、現在の土器編年上では古墳時代前期に属するとの説が有力になりつつある。
sen.e: In addition, today's most convincing theory classifies the earthwares excavated from Yayoi-cho, which was the origin of the name Yayoi period, as earthware of the early Kofun (tumulus period) period in present earthware chronology.

In addition, today's most convincing theory classifies the earthwares excavated from Yayoi-cho, which was the origin of the name Yayoi period, as earthware of the early Kofun (tumulus period) period in present earthware chronology.

In addition, today's most convincing theory classifies the earthwares excavated from Yayoi-cho, which was the origin of the name Yayoi period, as earthware of the early Kofun (tumulus period) period in present earthware chronology.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。

sen.j: 紀元前5世紀中頃に、大陸から北部九州へと水稲耕作技術を中心とした生活体系が伝わり、九州、四国、本州に広がった。
sen.e: Around the fifth century B.C., life style with the paddy-rice cultivations was introduced from the continent to northern Kyushu, and it spread to Kyushu, Shikoku and to Honshu (the main island of Japan).
sen.cmt: 大陸=the continentと訳しています。Chinese Continentと取れるのですが、ドキュメント中に東南アジアも含まれるような記述があるので、中国/中国大陸とない場合は、the continent と訳しています。
sen.e: Around the fifth century B.C., life style of rice-paddy cultivation was introduced from the continent to northern Kyushu, and it spread to Kyushu, Shikoku, and Honshu (the main island of Japan).
Around the fifth century B.C., life style of rice-paddy cultivation was introduced from the continent to northern Kyushu, and it spread to Kyushu, Shikoku, and Honshu (the main island of Japan).

sen.j: 初期の水田は、福岡市博多区にある板付遺跡や、佐賀県唐津市の菜畑遺跡、福岡県曲り田遺跡、福岡県野多目遺跡などで水田遺跡や大陸系磨製石器、炭化米等の存在が北部九州地域に集中して発見されている。
sen.e: Early paddy field remains including continental ground stoneware and carbonized rice were concentrated and discovered in northern Kyushu region, such as Itazuke site located at Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City, Nabatake site located at Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture, Magarita site located at Fukuoka Prefecture and Notame site located at Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: origianalの文章の主語があいまいです。「初期の水田は、」はその後の文中にある水田遺跡とあわせて考え、初期の水田遺跡や…と訳しています。
sen.e: Early paddy field remains including continental ground stoneware and carbonized rice were concentrated and discovered in the northern Kyushu region, such as the Itazuke site located at Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City, Nabatake site located at Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture, Magarita site located at Fukuoka Prefecture and Notame site located at Fukuoka Prefecture.

Early paddy field remains including continental ground stoneware and carbonized rice were concentrated and discovered in the northern Kyushu region, such as the Itazuke site located at Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City, Nabatake site located at Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture, Magarita site located at Fukuoka Prefecture and Notame site located at Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 弥生時代のはじまりである。
sen.e: It was the beginning of Yayoi period.
It was the beginning of the Yayoi period.
It was the beginning of the Yayoi period.

sen.j: 近年になって水稲である温帯ジャポニカは縄文晩期には導入されていたことが判明しつつある。
sen.e: In recent years, some evidence shows that the temperate Japonica-rice, a paddy-rice plant, was introduced by the end of Jomon period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In recent years, some evidence shows that the temperate Japonica-rice, a rice-paddy plant, was introduced by the end of Jomon period.
In recent years, some evidence shows that the temperate Japonica-rice, a rice-paddy plant, was introduced by the end of Jomon period.

sen.j: さらに近年の放射性炭素年代測定により弥生時代の始まりが少なくとも紀元前10世紀まで遡る可能性が出てきている。
sen.e: Moreover, there is a possibility of the start of Yayoi period to go back to tenth century B.C. by recent radiocarbon dating.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, there is a possibility of the start of the Yayoi period going back to the tenth century B.C. by recent radiocarbon dating.
Moreover, there is a possibility of the start of the Yayoi period going back to at least the 10th century B.C. by recent radiocarbon dating.
sen.cmt: tenth→10th と修正しました。at least を補いました。

sen.j: また、イネの伝来ルートについても従来は朝鮮ルートが有力視されていたが、遼東半島や朝鮮北部での水耕田跡が近代まで見つからないこと、朝鮮半島での確認された炭化米が紀元前2000年が最古であり畑作米の確認しか取れない点、極東アジアにおける温帯ジャポニカ種（水稲）/熱帯ジャポニカ種（陸稲）の遺伝分析において、朝鮮半島を含む中国東北部から当該遺伝子の存在が確認されないことなどの複数の証左から、水稲は大陸からの直接伝来ルート（対馬暖流ルート・東南アジアから南方伝来ルート等）による伝来である学説が有力視されつつある（従来の説とは逆に水稲は日本から朝鮮半島へ伝わった可能性も考えられている）。
sen.e: Furthermore, although Korean route was traditionally regarded as a likely introduction route for rice, the theory stating that paddy-rice plant was introduced through the direct introduction route from the continent (Tsushima Warm Current route/Southern introduction route from South East Asia) is now regarded as very likely from the several facts that remains of paddy-rice fields are not discovered in Liaodong Peninsula and northern Korea until site of modern times, the oldest carbonated rice found in Korean Peninsula only goes back to 2000 B.C., the only a rice plant grown in a dry field are confirmed from the time, and genetic analysis of temperate Japonica rice (a paddy-rice plant)/tropical Japonica rice (a rice plant grown in a dry field) in the Far East Asia shows no evidence of concerned genes from Korean Peninsula and North East China (contrary to traditional theory, there is a possibility that paddy-rice plant had been introduced to Korean Peninsula from Japan).

Furthermore, although the Korean route was traditionally regarded as a likely introduction route for rice, the theory stating that rice-paddy plants were introduced through the direct introduction route from the continent (Tsushima Warm Current route/Southern introduction route from South East Asia) is now regarded as very likely from the several facts that remains of rice-paddy fields were not discovered in the Liaodong Peninsula and northern Korea until sites of modern times, the oldest carbonated rice found in the Korean Peninsula only goes back to 2000 B.C., the only a rice plants grown in a dry field were confirmed from that time, and genetic analysis of temperate Japonica rice (a rice-paddy plant)/tropical Japonica rice (a rice plant grown in a dry field) in Far East Asia shows no evidence of concerned genes from Korean Peninsula nor from North East China (contrary to traditional theory, there is a possibility that rice-paddy plants had been introduced into Korean Peninsula from Japan).

Furthermore, although the Korean route was traditionally regarded as a likely introduction route for rice, the theory stating that rice-paddy plants were introduced through the direct introduction route from the continent (Tsushima Warm Current route/Southern introduction route from South East Asia) is now regarded as very likely from the several facts that remains of rice-paddy fields were not discovered in the Liaodong Peninsula and northern Korea until sites of modern times, the oldest carbonated rice found in the Korean Peninsula only goes back to 2000 B.C., the only a rice plants grown in a dry field were confirmed from that time, and genetic analysis of temperate Japonica rice (a rice-paddy plant)/tropical Japonica rice (a rice plant grown in a dry field) in Far East Asia shows no evidence of concerned genes from Korean Peninsula nor from North East China (Contrary to traditional theory, there is a possibility that rice-paddy plants had been introduced into Korean Peninsula from Japan.)
sen.cmt: カッコ部分、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: 紀元前10世紀後半に北部九州に伝わった水田稲作は、近畿南部に伝播するまでに300～400年、南関東までは実に700～800年ほど経過している。
sen.e: Paddy-rice cultivation that was introduced around the end of tenth century B.C. took 300 to 400 years to spread to Southern Kinki region and 700 to 800 years to spread to Southern Kanto region.

Rice-paddy cultivation that was introduced around the end of tenth century B.C. and took 300 to 400 years to spread to the Southern Kinki region and 700 to 800 years to spread to the Southern Kanto region.

Rice-paddy cultivation that was introduced around the end of 10th century B.C. and took 300 to 400 years to spread to the Southern Kinki region and 700 to 800 years to spread to the Southern Kanto region.

sen.j: 昭和56年(1981)、弥生時代中期の遺跡が青森県南津軽郡田舎館村垂柳遺跡から広範囲に整然とした水田区画が見つかっている。
sen.e: In 1981, remains of large-scale-well-ordered paddy field section from the middle of Yayoi period were found in Tareyanagi site located in Inakadate Village, Minamitsugaru-gun, Aomori Prefecture.
sen.cmt: originalの文、特に主語があいまいです。弥生時代中期の、広範囲で整然とした水田区画の遺跡が、と訳しました。
sen.e: In 1981, remains of large-scale-well-ordered paddy field sections from the middle of the Yayoi period were found in the Tareyanagi site located in Inakadate Village, Minamitsugaru-gun, Aomori Prefecture.

In 1981, remains of large-scale-well-ordered paddy field sections from the middle of the Yayoi period were found in the Tareyanagi site located in Inakadate Village, Minamitsugaru-gun, Aomori Prefecture.

sen.j: その後、弥生時代前期には東北へと伝播し、青森県弘前市砂沢遺跡では小規模な水田跡が発見され、中期には、中央高地の松本平、信濃川流域までひろがった。
sen.e: Paddy-rice cultivation had spread to Tohoku region in the early Yayoi period that a small remains of paddy field was discovered in Sunazawa site located in Hirosaki City, Aomori Prefecture, and it had spread to Matsumotodaira in Chuokochi and the Shinano River area in the middle of Yayoi period.

Rice-paddy cultivation had spread to the Tohoku region during the early Yayoi period and a small remains of a rice-paddy field was discovered in the Sunazawa site located in Hirosaki City, Aomori Prefecture, and it had spread to Matsumotodaira in Chuokochi and the Shinano River area during the middle of the Yayoi period.

Rice-paddy cultivation had spread to the Tohoku region during the early Yayoi period and a small remains of a rice-paddy field was discovered in the Sunazawa site located in Hirosaki City, Aomori Prefecture, and it had spread to Matsumoto-daira Basin in Chuokochi (Central Highlands) and the Shinano-gawa River area during the middle of the Yayoi period.
sen.cmt: (Central Highlands) を補い補強しました。Matsumotodaira→Matsumoto-daira Basin, Shinano River→Shinano-gawa River と修正しました。

sen.j: 中部地方の高地にひろがるまでには200年という期間がかかった。
sen.e: It took 200 years to spread to highland in Chubu region.
It took 200 years to spread to the highlands in the Chubu region.
It took 200 years to spread to the highlands in the Chubu region.

sen.j: その理由の一つに感光性のモミが日照時間の短い中部高地では育たないということがあげられる。
sen.e: One of the reasons for taking such long years is that photosensitive paddy does not grow in Chubu highland where hours of sunlight are short.
One of the reasons for taking such a long time was that photosensitive rice does not grow in the Chubu highland where hours of sunlight are short.
One of the reasons for taking such a long time was that photosensitive rice does not grow in the Chubu highland where hours of sunlight are short.

sen.j: 水稲農耕は、かなりな速さで日本列島を縦断し伝播波及したといえる。
sen.e: Paddy-rice cultivation quickly spread across the Japanese Archipelago.
Rice-paddy cultivation quickly spread across the Japanese Archipelago.
Rice-paddy cultivation quickly spread across the Japanese Archipelago.

sen.j: 田を作った人々は、弥生土器を作り、多くの場合竪穴住居に住み、倉庫として掘立柱建物や貯蔵穴を作った。
sen.e: People who created paddy field made Yayoi earthware, many cases lived in pit-type dwellings and built dug-standing pillar building and storage pit.
People who created paddy fields made Yayoi earthware, in many cases lived in pit-type dwellings and built a dug-standing pillar building and a storage pit.
People who created paddy fields made Yayoi earthware, in many cases lived in pit-type dwellings and built a dug-standing pillar building and a storage pit.

sen.j: 集落は、居住する場所と墓とがはっきりと区別するように作られ、居住域の周囲にはしばしば環濠集落が掘削された。
sen.e: Settlement had clear division between living area and graves, and village surrounded by a moat were excavated around the area of living.
sen.cmt: 「居住域の周囲にはしばしば環濠集落が掘削された」ではなく、「居住域の周囲にはしばしば堀が掘削された」ではないでしょうか？（堀にかこまれた居住域＝環濠集落）訳はoriginalどおりです。
sen.e: Settlements had clear divisions between the living area and graves, and the village surrounded by a moat were excavated around the area of living.
Settlements had clear divisions between the living area and graves, and the village surrounded by a moat were excavated around the area of living.

sen.j: 道具は、工具や耕起具、調理具などに石器を多く使ったが、次第に石器にかえて徐々に鉄器を使うようになった。
sen.e: Stone tools were used for implements, agriculture cultivation tool and cookware, but gradually shifted to ironware from stoneware.
Stone tools were used for implements, agriculture cultivation tool and cookware, but gradually shifted to ironware from stoneware.
Stone tools were used for implements, agriculture cultivation tool and cookware, but gradually shifted to ironware from stoneware.

sen.j: 青銅器は当初武器として、その後は祭祀具として用いられた。
sen.e: Bronze ware was originally used as a weapon and was later used as a religious service tools.
Bronze ware was originally used as a weapon and was later used as a religious service accessories.
Bronze ware was originally used as a weapon and was later used as a religious service accessories.

sen.j: また、農具や食膳具などとして木器もしばしば用いられた。
sen.e: Also wooden tools are often used as farming equipments and dinning tools.
Also wooden tools were often used as farming equipment and dinning utensils.
Also wooden tools were often used as farming equipment and dinning utensils.

sen.j: 弥生時代には農業、特に水稲農耕の採用によって穀物の備蓄が可能になった。
sen.e: In Yayoi period, adaptation of farming, especially paddy-rice cultivation, enabled accumulation of grain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the Yayoi period, adaptation of farming, especially rice-paddy cultivation, enabled the accumulation of grain.
During the Yayoi period, adaptation of farming, especially rice-paddy cultivation, enabled the storage of grain.

sen.j: このことから、余剰作物の生産と蓄積がすすみ、これが富に転化することにより、持てるものと持たざるもの、ひいては貧富の差や上下関係が生まれた。
sen.e: Therefore, production and accumulation of surplus crops increased and it had changed to wealth, which created the haves and the have-nots leading to the disparity between rich and poor and superior-inferior relationship.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, production and accumulation of surplus crops increased and it had changed to wealth, which created the haves and the have-nots leading to the disparity between rich and poor and a superior-inferior relationship.

Therefore, production and storage of surplus crops increased and it changed to wealth, which created the haves and the have-nots leading to the disparity between rich and poor and a superior-inferior relationship.
sen.cmt: accumulation→storage と修正しました。（「蓄積＝たくさんたくわえること」から）,it had changed→it changed と修正しました。

sen.j: また、水稲耕作技術の導入により、開墾や用水の管理などに大規模な労働力が必要とされるようになり、集団の大型化が進行した。
sen.e: Also groups became large sized by introduction of paddy-rice cultivation techniques, as cultivation and management of agricultural water required large labor force.
Also groups became large sized by introduction of rice-paddy cultivation techniques, as cultivation and management of agricultural water required a large labor force.
Also groups became large sized by the introduction of rice-paddy cultivation techniques, as the cultivation and management of agricultural water required a large labor force.

sen.j: 大型化した集団同士の間には、富や耕作地、水利権などをめぐって戦いが発生したとされる。

sen.j: このような争いを通じた集団の統合・上下関係の進展の結果、やがて各地に小さなクニが生まれた。
sen.e: As a result of integration of groups and progression of superior-inferior relationship in the battles, small provinces were created in various regions.

sen.j: 1世紀中頃に倭奴国王印が後漢から、3世紀中葉には邪馬台国の女王（卑弥呼）が魏 (三国)に朝貢し、倭の王であることを意味する金印を授けられた。
sen.e: In the middle of first century, Wa no na no kokuo in (the oldest known seal in Japan) was sent to Japan from the Later Han Dynasty and in middle of third century, the queen of Yamatai-Koku Kingdom (Himiko) paid tribute to Wei dynasty (Three States Period) and presented with golden seal which implies the king of Wa (Japan).

sen.j: なお、この頃以降の日本は、大陸からは倭と呼ばれた。

sen.j: 一方、南西諸島と樺太・北海道には水田が作られず、南西諸島では貝塚時代、ついでグスク時代、樺太・北海道では続縄文時代、ついで擦文時代（さつもん）が続いた（また、本州東北地方では、青森県垂柳遺跡のように弥生時代前期の水田の事例もあるものの、一般的には中期後半前後まで水稲農耕は完全に受容されたとはいえず、北海道に準じ続縄文文化が展開したとの見方もある）。
sen.e: On the other hand, paddy fields did not spread in Nansei Islands and Sakhalin/Hokkaido, therefore Shell mound period then Gusuku period followed after Jomon period in Nansei Islands and Post Jomon period then Satsumon period followed after Jomon period in Sakhalin/Hokkaido (although there was a example of paddy field in the early Yayoi period shown in Tareyanagi site in Aomori Prefecture, paddy-rice cultivation also did not widely spread in Tohoku region in Honshu until the middle to the late Yayoi period and some theory views that Post Jomon period followed like Hokkaido).

On the other hand, rice-paddies did not spread in the Nansei Islands and Sakhalin/Hokkaido, therefore, the Shell mound period and then the Gusuku period followed the Jomon period in the Nansei Islands and Post Jomon period then Satsumon period followed after the Jomon period in Sakhalin/Hokkaido (although there was an example of a rice-paddy during the early Yayoi period shown in the Tareyanagi site in Aomori Prefecture, rice-paddy cultivation also did not widely spread in Tohoku region in Honshu until the middle to the late Yayoi period and some theoretical views that Post Jomon period followed like in Hokkaido).

sen.e: Also the third century was a regression period when the seawater receded and sand carried by rivers deposited over clay layer at the bottom of dried up ponds and lakes.

sen.j: そもそも弥生時代とは、弥生式土器が使われている時代という意味であった。
sen.e: Originally Yayoi period meant for the period that used Yayoi earthware.
Originally the Yayoi period meant the period that used Yayoi earthenware.

sen.j: ところが、弥生式土器には米、あるいは水稲農耕技術体系が伴うことが徐々に明らかになってきた。
sen.e: However the fact that Yayoi earthware required rice or paddy-rice cultivation techniques were gradually came to known.

sen.j: すると、弥生時代とは、水稲農耕による食料生産に基礎を置く農耕社会であって、前段階である縄文時代（狩猟採集社会）とはこの点で区別されるべきだとする考え方が主流になっていった。
sen.e: Then a point of view that Yayoi period was a agrarian society based on food production by paddy-rice cultivation and should be distinguished from its previous period, Jomon period (a hunting and gathering society), became the mainstream.

sen.e: Yusu earthware stage was originally considered as the latter half of the last of Jomon period, but an opinion stating that the stage was at agrarian society was submitted, as the period already adapted paddy-rice cultivation techniques.

sen.j: その後、縄文時代と弥生時代の差を何に求めるべきかという本質的な論争が研究者の間で展開され、集落の形態や墓の形態、水田の有無、土器・石器など物質文化の変化など様々な指標が提案された。
sen.e: After that, an essential subject of what would be the difference between Jomon and Yayoi period, was argued between researchers and various indicators were proposed, including forms of settlement, forms of grave, presence or absence of paddy field and changes in artifacts such as earthware and stoneware.

sen.j: 現在ではおおよそ、水稲農耕技術を安定的に受容した段階以降を弥生時代とするという考えが定着している。
sen.e: Presently Yayoi period is roughly classified as a stage after a stable adaptation of paddy-rice cultivation techniques.
Presently the Yayoi period is roughly classified as a stage after the stable adaptation of rice-paddy cultivation techniques.

sen.j: 従って、弥生時代前期前半より以前に（夜臼式土器に代表されるような刻目突帯文土器と総称される一群の土器形式に示された）水稲農耕技術を伴う社会が（少なくとも北部九州地域には）成立していたとされる。
sen.e: Therefore, society with paddy-rice cultivation techniques (at least in northern Kyushu) existed before the first half of early Yayoi period (shown in a form of earthwares celled Kizamimetottaimon earthware such as Yusu earthware).

sen.e: Also a possibility that the adaptation of paddy-rice cultivation in a part of northern Kyushu to go back to the first half of last of Jomon period is indicated but clear evidence of ancient structural remnants are not yet discovered and is still a speculation.

sen.j: 弥生時代の時期区分は、従来、前期・中期・後期の3期に分けられていたが、近年では上記の研究動向をふまえ、早期・前期・中期・後期の4期区分論が主流になりつつある。
sen.e: Yayoi period was originally divided to 3 periods, which were early period, middle period and end period, but recently Yayoi period is divided to 4 periods, which are earlier period, early period, middle period and end period, based on above stated researches.

sen.j: 最近になって、国立歴史民俗博物館の研究グループによる放射性炭素年代測定を活用した一連の研究成果により、弥生時代の開始期を大幅に繰り上げるべきだと主張する説がでてきた。
sen.e: Recently, there is a theory insisting to move back the start date of Yayoi period dramatically, based on radioactive carbon dating research results shown by a research group from National Museum of Japanese History.

sen.j: これによると、早期のはじまりが約600年遡り紀元前1000年頃から、前期のはじまりが約500年遡り紀元前800年頃から、中期のはじまりが約200年遡り紀元前400年頃から、後期のはじまりが紀元50年頃からとなり、古墳時代への移行はほぼ従来通り3世紀中葉となる。

sen.j: 戦乱の時代－環濠集落と高地性集落－

sen.j: 弥生時代は、前代（縄文時代）とはうってかわって、集落・地域間の戦争が頻発した時代であったとされる。
sen.e: In contrast to previous period (Jomon period), it is believed that battles between settlements and regions occurred frequently in Yayoi period.

sen.j: 集落の周りに濠をめぐらせた環濠集落や、低地から100m以上の比高差を持つような山頂部に集落を構える高地性集落などは、集落間の争いがあったことの証拠とされた。
sen.e: Moat settlements that have a moat around the settlement and upland settlements that were located at top of the mountain with more than 100m in its height are said to be the evidence of battles between settlements.

sen.j: 弥生時代前期の墓には、人骨の胸から腰にかけての位置から十五本の石鏃が出土した例がある。
sen.e: A human bone with 15 Sekizoku (a flint arrowhead) at chest to waist area was excavated from a grave of early Yayoi period.

sen.e: Cases of graves that yielded human bones with many Sekizoku around chest area are often found in western Japan, around in Seto Inland Sea.

sen.j: 以前には、こうした例は、戦闘の際に矢を何本も射込まれて、やっと倒れた人物と解釈されることが多く、「英雄」などとも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Previously, these examples were interpreted as a person who fell in a battle after being shot many arrows and the person was called a 'Hero'.

sen.j: しかしながら近年では、矢を特定の部位に集中して射込まれていることの不自然さから、むしろ埋葬の際に副葬品として鏃を胸のあたりに埋納した、あるいは何らかの儀礼的行為の際の犠牲（生け贄）となって胸に矢を射込まれたなどといった解釈も現れている。
sen.e: However, because of its unnaturalness of arrowhead concentrating in a specific area, recently new interpretations are arising such as; arrowheads were buried as burial goods, or a person was shot arrows as a sacrifice (sacrificial offering) in some kind of rituals.

sen.j: また、北部九州では、前期から中期にかけて銅剣・銅戈・石剣・石戈の切っ先が棺内から出土することが多い。
sen.e: Moreover, tip of bronze swords, doka (bronze halberds for ritual), stone swords, and stone halberds are excavated from a coffin of the early to middle Yayoi period in northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 銅戈：bronze dagger-axe となっているのですが、戈とは、ピッケル状の長柄武器で、銅戈（どうか）の訳はbronze halberd（斧槍の意)となっています。用語集のdagger-axeでは、斧は当てはまるのですが、daggerは短剣を意味するので、長柄武器とはなりません。ただ、銅矛の訳もbronze halberdとなっており、日本では銅戈は戦闘ではなく祭祀用であったため、銅戈：doka (bronze halberd for ritual)とした方がよいのではないかと思います。以下、銅戈：doka (bronze halberd for ritual)と訳します。
sen.e: Moreover, the tip of bronze swords, doka (bronze halberds for ritual), stone swords, and stone halberds were excavated from a coffin of the early to the middle Yayoi period in northern Kyushu.
Moreover, the tip of bronze swords, doka (bronze halberds for ritual), stone swords, and stone halberds are often excavated from a coffin of the early to the middle Yayoi period in northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: were→are often と修正しました。

sen.j: こうした例は、従来、武器を人体に刺突した際に先端が折れて体内に残ったものと解釈されてきた。
sen.e: These examples are previously thought as a remains of weapon breaking off when stabbing a human body.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: These examples are previously thought of as remains of a weapon breaking off when stabbing the human body.
Up to now, these examples are thought of as remains of a weapon breaking off when stabbing the human body.
sen.cmt: previously→up to now to 修正しました。（「従来＝以前から今まで」ということから）

sen.j: しかし、これも、武器の先端を折りとって副葬品として棺内に埋納するという風習があったのではないかといった反論がだされており、決着はついていない。
sen.e: However there is a counterargument that there could be a custom to burry tip of weapons as burial goods inside the coffin and the argument has not yet seen a settlement.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However there is a counter argument that there could be a custom to burry tip of weapons as burial goods inside the coffin and the argument has not yet been settled.
However there is a counter argument that there could be a custom to bury tip of weapons as burial goods inside the coffin and the argument has not yet been settled.

sen.j: さらに、佐賀県吉野ヶ里遺跡や福岡県筑紫野隈・西小田遺跡などでは、中期前葉の男性甕棺数が女性の倍にも達する事実は男性が戦闘に参加する機会が多いことを示すと考えられる。
sen.e: Moreover, the fact that number of kamekan (earthenware jar-coffin) for male excavated in Yoshinogari site at Saga Prefecture and Kuma/Nishioda site at Chikushi City, Fukuoka Prefecture is double the number of female's, which is interpreted as male had more occasion joining in the battle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, the fact that a number of kamekan (earthenware jar-coffin) for males excavated at the Yoshinogari site at Saga Prefecture and Kuma/Nishioda site at Chikushi City, Fukuoka Prefecture is double the number of female's, which is interpreted as the males had more occasion to join in battle.

Moreover, the fact that a number of kamekan (earthenware jar-coffin) for males excavated at the Yoshinogari site at Saga Prefecture and Kuma/Nishioda site at Chikushi City, Fukuoka Prefecture is double the number of female's, which is interpreted as the males had more occasion to join in battle.

sen.j: 甕棺内に頭部を除く全身が埋葬されていたと考えられる事例が見つかっており、しばしば戦闘の際に敵に頭部を切り取られた死者を連れ帰り、埋葬したものと理解されているが、このような例が本当に戦闘の犠牲者なのか、それとも何らかの儀礼的行為によるものなのかは実際のところは未だ論証されていない。
sen.e: Also in some cases, kamekan with whole body except the head part were excavated, and these were interpreted as a enemy took the victim's head from the battle field and the victim's body was taken back to settlement for burial, however it is not proved if they really were a victim of a battle, or if it was a result of some ritual.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also in some cases, kamekan with whole body except the head part were excavated, and these were interpreted as an enemy taking the victim's head from the battle field and the victim's body was taken back to the settlement for burial, however it is not proven if they really were victims of a battle, or if it was the result of some ritual.

Also in some cases, kamekan with whole body except the head part were excavated, and these were interpreted as an enemy taking the victim's head from the battle field and the victim's body was taken back to the settlement for burial, however it is not proven if they really were victims of a battle, or if it was the result of some ritual.

sen.j: これに対して、受傷人骨の中でも、明らかに武器によってつけられたと考えられる傷のある人骨の存在は、戦闘の存在を示す証拠として扱うことが可能である。
sen.e: Among these human bones with trauma, there are human bones with clear sign of weapon trauma and they are treated as the evidence of existence of battles.
Among these human bones with trauma, there are human bones with a clear sign of weapon trauma and they are treated as the evidence of the existence of battles.
Among these human bones with trauma, there are human bones with a clear sign of weapon trauma and they are treated as the evidence of the existence of battles.

sen.j: 例えば、額から右眼にかけて致命的な傷痕があり、更に右手首を骨折していた人骨が見つかっているが、右手首の骨折は、攻撃から身を守る際につけられる、防御創と呼ばれる種類の傷としては一般的なもので、争いによる受傷者である可能性は極めて高い。
sen.e: For example, a human bone with fatal wound across the forehead to right eye and broken right wrist, which is a typical defensive wound happens when defending body from an attack, was excavated, and it is very likely that the person was wounded.

For example, a human bone with fatal wound across the forehead to right eye and broken right wrist, which is a typical defensive wound thqt happens when defending from attack, was excavated, and it is very likely that the person was wounded.

For example, a human bone with fatal wound across the forehead to right eye and broken right wrist, which is a typical defensive wound that happens when defending from attack, was excavated, and it is very likely that the person was wounded by fighting.
sen.cmt: thqt→that と修正しました。「争いによる」を補いました。

sen.j: また、人骨に武器の切っ先が嵌入している事例も、北部九州を中心に数例が確認されているが、これらは武器による受傷人骨であることが明らかである。
sen.e: Also there are several cases with tip of weapons impacted human bones in northern Kyushu, and they are clearly the human bones with weapon trauma.
Also there are several cases with tip of weapons impacted human bones in northern Kyushu, and they are clearly human bones showing weapon trauma.
Also there are several cases with tip of weapons impacted human bones in northern Kyushu, and they are clearly human bones showing weapon trauma.

sen.j: このような受傷人骨の例は縄文時代にもないわけではないが、弥生時代には前代と比べて明らかに数が増加しており、縄文時代と比べて戦闘が頻繁に起こったことは確実といえる。
sen.e: There are these types of human bones with trauma from Jomon period, however number of the cases clearly increased in Yayoi period and definitely the battles were more frequent compared to Jomon period.

There are these types of human bones with trauma from the Jomon period, however the number of cases clearly increased during the Yayoi period and definitely the battles were more frequent compared to the Jomon period.

There are these types of human bones with trauma from the Jomon period, however the number of cases clearly increased during the Yayoi period and definitely the battles were more frequent compared to the Jomon period.

sen.j: また、戦闘の証拠とされる上記のような事例のうち、武器の切っ先が棺内から出土する例、頭部がない人骨、あるいは人骨に残る受傷例などは、前期後半～中期前半の北部九州地域、特に福岡県小郡市を中心とした地域に多く認められることが特徴的である。
sen.e: Among above descried evidence of battles, cases with tip of weapon in the coffin, human bone without head and bone trauma are often found from the latter half of early period to the first half of middle period in northern Kyushu region, especially in regions around Ogori City, Fukuoka Prefecture.

Among the above described evidence of battles, cases with a tip of a weapon in the coffin, human bones without a head and bone trauma are often found from the latter half of the early period to the first half of middle period in the northern Kyushu region, especially in regions around Ogori City, Fukuoka Prefecture.

Among the above described evidence of battles, cases with a tip of a weapon in the coffin, human bones without a head and bone trauma are often found from the latter half of the early period to the first half of middle period in the northern Kyushu region, especially in regions around Ogori City, Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 弥生前期後半から中期前半は、西日本の多くの地域で集落が可耕地に乏しい丘陵上へと一斉に進出することが指摘されている。
sen.e: Many settlements in western Japan area are said to have moved up hills, where lacked large cultivation area, at once in the latter half of early period to the first half of middle period in Yayoi period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Many settlements in western Japan are said to have been moved up hill, that lacked large cultivation areas, at once in the latter half of early period to the first half of middle period in Yayoi period.

Many settlements in western Japan are said to have been moved up hill, that lacked large cultivation areas, at once in the latter half of early period to the first half of middle period in Yayoi period.

sen.j: 各地域において弥生集団が急激な人口の増加を背景に可耕地の拡大を求めた時期であるとされる。
sen.e: It is suspected that many settlements sought for more cultivation area in each region, due to the rapid increase in population of Yayoi group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is suspected that many settlements sought more cultivation areas in each region, due to the rapid increase in population of the Yayoi group.
It is suspected that many settlements sought more cultivation areas in each region, due to the rapid increase in population of the Yayoi group.

sen.j: この可耕地の拡大が原因となって、各地で土地と水に絡む戦いが頻発したものと考えられ、中でも北部九州における受傷人骨の多さは、こうした争いが頻発した証拠と考えられている。
sen.e: This expansion in cultivation area caused many battles over land and water in various regions, especially number of human bones with trauma found in northern Kyushu support frequent occurrence of the battles.

This expansion in cultivation areas caused many battles over land and water in various regions, especially number of human bones with trauma found in northern Kyushu support the frequent occurrence of battles.

This expansion in cultivation areas caused many battles over land and water in various regions, especially the number of human bones with trauma found in northern Kyushu provide the evidence of the frequent occurrence of battles.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。support→provide the evidence of を補いました。

sen.j: なお、中期後半以降は受傷人骨や切先が棺内から出土する例は減少する。
sen.e: Excavation of human bones with trauma and tip of weapon in the coffin decrease on and after the latter half of middle period.
Excavation of human bones with trauma and tips of weapons in the coffin decreased on and after the latter half of middle period.
Excavation of human bones with trauma and tips of weapons in the coffin decreased on and after the latter half of middle period.

sen.j: 環濠集落は、このような集団同士の争いに備えた防衛集落であったと考えられていた。
sen.e: Moat settlement was believed to be a defensive settlement against the battles between groups.
A moat settlement was believed to be a defense against battles between groups.
A moat settlement was believed to be a defense against battles between groups.

sen.j: しかし、環濠集落の出現は、未だ戦闘の証拠がほとんどない弥生時代早期にさかのぼること（福岡県江辻遺跡、同那珂遺跡群など）、受傷人骨などの事例から戦乱が頻発したと考えられる前期後半～中期前半、特に中期初頭以降の北部九州ではむしろ環濠集落の事例は少ないこと、しばしば環濠を掘削する際に排出された土を利用して環濠の外側に盛り土をした痕跡のある事例が報告されているが、環濠の外側に盛り土をすることによって、外敵を有利にしてしまう（外敵は、盛り土を矢避けにしたり、盛り土の上から攻撃できる）ことなどから、環濠集落と戦乱とを直接的に関連づける、すなわち環濠集落を防衛集落と考える研究者は最近では少なくなってきている。
sen.e: However, recently not many researchers consider moat settlements as a defensive settlements and directly relate moat settlements with wars, because of several reasons such as; emergence of moat settlement goes back to earlier Yayoi period when there are very little evidence of battles (Etsuji site and Nakai sites in Fukuoka Prefecture), less moat settlements are excavated from northern Kyushu in the latter half of early period to first half of middle period, especially beginning of middle period when frequent wars thought to have occurred from evidence of human bones with trauma, and a banking were created outside the moat in some cases using soil dug up to make the moat, which gives advantage to enemies (enemies can use bank as shield against arrows and also can attack from top of the bank).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, recently not many researchers consider moat settlements as defensive and directly related with wars, for several reasons such as; the emergence of moat settlement goes back to earlier Yayoi period when there was very little evidence of battles (Etsuji site and Nakai sites in Fukuoka Prefecture), less moat settlements are excavated from northern Kyushu in the latter half of early period to first half of middle period, especially beginning of middle period when frequent wars were thought to have occurred from the evidence of human bones with trauma, and banks were created outside the moat in some cases using soil dug up to make the moat, which gives an advantage to the enemy (enemy can use the bank as a shield against arrows and also can attack from the top of a bank).

However, recently not many researchers consider moat settlements as defensive and directly related with wars, for several reasons such as; the emergence of moat settlement goes back to earlier Yayoi period when there was very little evidence of battles (Etsuji site and Nakai sites in Fukuoka Prefecture), less moat settlements are excavated from northern Kyushu in the latter half of early period to first half of middle period, especially beginning of middle period when frequent wars were thought to have occurred from the evidence of human bones with trauma, and banks were created outside the moat in some cases using soil dug up to make the moat, which gives an advantage to the enemy (Enemy can use the bank as a shield against arrows and also can attack from the top of a bank.)
sen.cmt: カッコ部分、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: それよりは、環濠を掘削するという大規模な土木作業を共同で行うことによって共同体の結束を高めることが目的であったとか、環濠によって集団を囲い込むことによって集団意識を高めることが目的であったなどといった議論も提出されてきている。
sen.e: There are other opinions such as large scale public work, like digging up moat, was practiced to tighten the union of the community, or to create and increase group consciousness by enclosing the group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There are other opinions such as large scale public work, like digging a moat, was practiced to tighten the union of the community, or to create and increase group consciousness by enclosing the group.

There are other opinions such as large scale public work, such as digging a moat, was practiced to tighten the union of the community, or to create and increase group consciousness by enclosing the group.
sen.cmt: like→such as と修正しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、弥生時代後期の高地性集落にしばしば環濠が掘削されていること、環濠内に逆茂木（さかもぎ）と呼ばれる防御施設が設置された事例が認められる（愛知県朝日遺跡など）。
sen.e: However moat was often dug in upland settlement in the end of Yayoi period and Sakamogi (fence made of thorny or steeple branches to prevent entry of an enemy) was placed at moat in some cases (Asahi site at Aichi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However a moat was often dug in an upland settlement during the end of the Yayoi period and Sakamogi (fence made of thorny or steeple branches to prevent entry of an enemy) were placed at the moat in some cases (Asahi site at Aichi Prefecture).

However a moat was often dug in an upland settlement during the end of the Yayoi period and Sakamogi (fence made of thorny or steeple branches to prevent entry of an enemy) were placed at the moat in some cases (Asahi site at Aichi Prefecture).

sen.j: このことから、環濠自体に防御的な機能を持たせた事例が存在することもまた明らかであり、環濠の性格については地域・時期によって異なる意味づけを持たせるべきではないかといった主張は説得力がある。
sen.e: These indicate that some moat was equipped with defending facilities and an opinion insisting that function of moat should be considered depending on region and period is very persuasive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: These indicate that some moats were equipped with defending facilities and an opinion insisting that the function of the moat should be considered depending upon the region and period is very persuasive.

These indicate that some moats were equipped with defending facilities and an opinion insisting that the function of the moat should be considered depending upon the region and period is very persuasive.

sen.j: 一方、やはり古くから防衛集落と目されてきた集落の類型として、高地性集落が挙げられる。
sen.e: On the other hand, upland settlements are long considered as a type of defensive settlement.
On the other hand, upland settlements have been long considered a type of defensive settlement.
On the other hand, upland settlements have been long considered a type of defensive settlement.

sen.j: 高地性集落は、弥生時代中期後半～末（IV期後半～末）、そして後期中葉～末（V期中葉～末）に瀬戸内沿岸から大阪湾にかけて頻繁に見られるもので、弥生時代の一般的な集落からみて遙かに高い場所（平地からの比高差が50～300メートル以上）に営まれている集落のことである。
sen.e: Upland settlements are often found at Setouchi seacoast to Osaka Bay in the latter to end of middle of Yayoi period (the latter to end of IV period) and middle to end of end period (the middle to end of V period) and they are settlements located at very high ground compared to general settlement in Yayoi period (50 to 300 meters high compared to flatland).

Upland settlements are often found along the Setouchi seacoast to Osaka Bay in the latter to end of the middle of the Yayoi period (the latter to the end of IV period) and middle to the end of the end period (the middle to the end of the V period) and they are settlements located at very high ground compared to general settlement in the Yayoi period (50 to 300 meters high compared to flatland).

Upland settlements are often found along the Setouchi seacoast to Osaka Bay in the latter to end of the middle of the Yayoi period (the latter to the end of IV period) and middle to the end of the end period (the middle to the end of the V period), and they are settlements located at very high ground compared to general settlement in the Yayoi period (50 to 300 meters high compared to flatland).

sen.j: 北部九州から北陸・中部・東海地域などといった広い範囲に分布する。
sen.e: They distribute widely across northern Kyushu to Hokuriku, Chubu and Tokai region.
They are distributed widely across northern Kyushu to Hokuriku, Chubu and Tokai region.
They are distributed widely across northern Kyushu to Hokuriku, Chubu and Tokai regions.

sen.j: 1970年代までは、畿内IV期がおおよそ北部九州の後期前半、畿内V期が後期後半に併行するとされ、実年代では紀元50年～250年ごろに比定されていた。
sen.e: Kinai IV period was considered to parallel the first half of end period in northern Kyushu and Kinai V period was considered to parallel the latter half of end period, and identified as 50 to 250 A.D. in actual chronology untill 1970s.

The Kinai IV period was considered to parallel the first half of the end period in northern Kyushu and the Kinai V period was considered to parallel the latter half of the end period, and identified as 50 to 250 A.D. in actual chronology untill 1970s.

The Kinai IV period was considered to parallel the first half of the end period in northern Kyushu and the Kinai V period was considered to parallel the latter half of the end period, and identified as 50 to 250 A.D. in actual chronology until 1970s.

sen.j: 史書にある、いわゆる倭国大乱は、各種の史書に記載された年代がおおよそ2世紀後半～末に当たり、当時の年代観ではおおよそ畿内IV期末～V期前半期に該当していた。
sen.e: History books describes Wakoku War had occurred around the latter to the end of the second century and it is around the end of Kinai IV period to the early V period in the period's view.
History books describe that the Wakoku War had occurred around the end of the second century and it is around the end of the Kinai IV period to the early V period in view of the period.
History books describe that the Wakoku War had occurred around the end of the second century and it is around the end of the Kinai IV period to the early V period in view of the period.

sen.j: このため、高地性集落の盛行は倭国大乱を原因とするものだという理解が主流であった。
sen.e: Therefore Wakoku War was considered as reason for the prosper of upland settlemets.
Therefore the Wakoku War was considered as a reason for the prospering of upland settlements.
Therefore the Wakoku War was considered as a reason for the prospering of the upland settlements.

sen.j: しかし、畿内と九州の年代の併行関係が是正された。
sen.e: However parallel relationship of Kinai and Kyushu periods were corrected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However the parallel relationship of the Kinai and Kyushu periods were corrected.
However the parallel relationship of the Kinai and Kyushu periods were corrected.

sen.j: 倭国大乱は畿内V期後半～末に該当し、畿内IV期の高地性集落とは時代的に整合的でないとされ、これらは倭国大乱とは無関係とする意見が主流を占めるようになった。
sen.e: According to correction, Wakoku War comes under the latter to end of Kinai V period, which has no periodical consistency with upland settlement, and theory stating upland settlement was not related to Wakoku War became the mainstream.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to a correction, the Wakoku War comes under the latter to end of the Kinai V period, which has no periodical consistency with upland settlements, and theory stating upland settlements were not related to the Wakoku War, became the mainstream.

According to a correction, the Wakoku War comes under the latter to end of the Kinai V period, which has no periodical consistency with upland settlements, and theory stating upland settlements were not related to the Wakoku War, became the mainstream.

sen.j: このため、畿内IV期の高地性集落については、この時期に史書には記載されない戦乱があったという主張の他に、背景に戦乱を想定する必要はないという意見も見られるようになった。
sen.e: Therefore, as for upland settlements in Kinai IV period, there is some opinion insisting that there were wars not described in history book in the period, as well as an opinion insisting that there is no need to assume wars for its background.

Therefore, as for upland settlements in the Kinai IV period, there is some opinion insisting that there were wars not described in history books during the period, as well as an opinion insisting that there is no need to assume wars for its background.

Therefore, as for upland settlements in the Kinai IV period, there is some opinion insisting that there were wars not described in history books during the period, as well as an opinion insisting that there is no need to assume wars for its background.

sen.j: 特に後者の場合、見晴らしがよい立地に住むことで、海上交通の見張り役となっていたとか、畑作を主とする生活をしていた集団であって水田耕作に有利な低地に住む必要がなかったなどといったさまざまな議論が行われており、未だ決着はついていない。
sen.e: The argument has not yet seen a settlement, especially the latter argues that living in location with wide view enabled to watch marine traffic, or it was a group mainly lived off with dry field farming and they did not need to live in low-lying ground, which is profitable for paddy-rice cultivation.

The argument has not yet seen a settlement, especially the latter argues that living in a location with a wide view enabled the monitoring of watch marine traffic, or it was a group that mainly lived off dry field farming and they did not need to live on a low-lying ground, which is profitable for rice-paddy cultivation.

The argument has not yet seen a settlement, especially the latter argues that living in a location with a wide view enabled the monitoring of watch marine traffic, or it was a group that mainly lived off dry field farming and they did not need to live on a low-lying ground, which is profitable for rice-paddy cultivation.

sen.j: 一方、後期後半期の近畿の高地性集落（大阪府和泉市観音寺山遺跡、同高槻市古曾部遺跡などは環濠を巡らす山城）については、その盛行期が、上述の理由から北部九州・畿内ともおおよそ史書に記載された倭国大乱の年代とほぼ一致することから、これらを倭国大乱と関連させる理解が主流を占めているようである。
sen.e: On the other hand, upland settlements in Kinki region in the latter half of end period (Kannonjiyama site at Izumi City, Osaka Prefecture and Kosobe site at Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture are mountain castle with moat) are considered to hold some relationship to Wakoku War, as its prospered period in both northern Kyushu and Kinai matches to the period of Wakoku War described in history book, after the correction of period described earlier.

sen.j: 最近、土器の焼成失敗品や、強い熱を受けたために器壁が薄くはじけるように割れた土器に注目して、大規模な集落で土器が集中的に生産された可能性が提起された。
sen.e: Recently earthware of firing failure and earthware with cracked surface from high temperature are studied and possibility of intensive earthware manufacturing in large-scale settlement was raised.

sen.j: また、土器の形態は地域性をきわめてよく表すため、その特徴に着目して他地域から搬入された可能性の高い土器と在地の土器とを峻別し、土器はこれまで思われていたよりもずっと多量に移動している可能性が指摘されている。
sen.e: From the fact that form of earthware strongly shows regionality, earthware manufactured in local land and earthware suspected to have brought in from other region was compared and there is a possibility of movement of larger amount of earthware than previously assumed.

sen.j: 木器は主に食膳具や耕起具として使われた。

sen.e: Although there are many excellent pieces of work in dinning tools, which are lacquer -covered and have fine decoration, it is rare for woodenware to excavate in good condition as they are easy to rot, and details are still not known.

sen.j: 集落
sen.e: Settlement
Settlements
Settlements

sen.j: 弥生時代の集落には様々な例があるが、一般的に発見されるものとして、居住施設としての竪穴住居、貯蔵施設としての貯蔵穴や掘立柱建物、ゴミ捨て場や土器の焼成など様々な用途に使われたと考えられる土坑（不定形の穴）、集落の周りを巡らせたり集落内部を区画するように掘られた溝（環濠や区画溝など）の遺構がある。
sen.e: There are several examples of settlement in Yayoi period and common examples of ancient structural remnants are; tateanajukyo (a pit dwelling house) as a dwelling, dug-standing pillar building and storage pit for storage facility, doko (a pit) (non-uniform shaped hole/pit) for various purposes such as garbage pit and firing of earthware, a ditch surrounding settlement and section in the settlement (a moat and a sectional ditch).

sen.j: 墓制
sen.e: The burial system
The burial system
The burial system

sen.j: 弥生時代の墓制を示す用語として、支石墓、墳丘墓、周溝墓などといった埋葬施設の外部施設（上部構造）を示す区分と、甕棺墓、土壙墓、木棺墓、石棺墓などといった個々の埋葬施設本体の形状（下部構造）を示す区分がある。
sen.e: There are two classification in terminology used in the burial system of Yayoi period, which are; terms describing outside facility of burial facility (upper structure) such as shisekibo (a dolmen), funkyubo (grave mound or tumulus) and shukobo (burial mound surrounded by moat), and terms describing individual shapes of actual burial facility (lower structure) such as kamekanbo (earthenware jar-coffin grave), dokobo (hole-shaped grave), mokkanbo (wooden coffin grave) and sekkanbo (stone coffin grave).

There are two classifications in terminology used in the burial system of the Yayoi period, which are; terms describing outside facility of burial facility (upper structure) such as shisekibo (a dolmen), funkyubo (grave mound or tumulus) and shukobo (burial mound surrounded by a moat), and terms describing individual shapes of actual burial facility (lower structure) such as kamekanbo (earthenware jar-coffin grave), dokobo (hole-shaped grave), mokkanbo (wooden coffin grave) and sekkanbo (stone coffin grave).

sen.j: いずれも、半島より渡来した要素と縄文文化より受け継いだ要素からなり、地域によって墓地の構成に様々な特色が見られる。
sen.e: All were formed with elements passed down from Jomon culture and elements brought from Korean Peninsula, and there were various characteristics of grave components in each region.

sen.j: 甕棺墓は、縄文時代後・晩期の埋甕習俗を下敷きとし、半島から伝来した壷形土器を埋葬容器として採用することにより成立したと考えられる。
sen.e: Kamekanbo was based on the manners and customs of maiyou (custom of burial in Jomon period, dead body etc was placed inside a pot and buried) in the end to last Jomon period, and was completed by adapting jar-shaped vessel from Korean Peninsula as a container for burial.

sen.e: Then standard sized kamegata earthware, which was used as daily container, started to be used as a burial container for child and infant; the kamekan (earthenware jar-coffin) burial system had been established.

sen.j: 弥生時代の木棺墓の大半は組合式と呼ばれるもので、一般的には、底板・両側板・両小口板・蓋板の計6枚の板材を組み合わせ、あらかじめ掘削された土坑の中に棺を作るものである。
sen.e: Majority of mokkanbo was called kumiaishiki (unit style), which were generally made combining 6 boards, a bottom board, two side boards, two end boards, and a lid board, and the coffin was made inside dug out hole.

sen.e: Hole-shaped grave, especially an excavation without shoring, was a common burial system in Jomon period and also often seen in Yayoi period.

sen.e: This was due to the difference in burial posture (crouched burial are often found in hole-shaped grave in Jomon period, on the other hand full-length burial was common in hole-shaped grave in Yayoi period).

sen.j: 中国との通交
sen.e: Amity with China
Amity with China

sen.j: 中国との通交は渡来系弥生人に遡ることができる。
sen.e: Amity with China goes back to Yayoi man who were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Amity with China goes back to Yayoi men who were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Amity with China goes back to Yayoi men who were immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 近年、DNAの研究が進み、渡来系弥生人の多くは中国大陸の長江流域、山東省付近から来たと言われている。
sen.e: Recent year's progress in DNA research unraveled that many of Yayoi man who were immigrants to ancient Japan came from the basin of the Yangtze River and area around Shandong Province in the Chinese continent.

Recent progress in DNA research unraveled that many Yayoi men who were immigrants to ancient Japan came from the basin of the Yangtze River and an area around Shandong Province on the Chinese continent.

Recent progress in DNA research unraveled that many Yayoi men who were immigrants to ancient Japan came from the basin of the Yangtze River and an area around Shandong Province on the Chinese continent.

sen.j: 更に遡ると現在の中国の青海省付近にまで遡ることができるという調査結果がある。
sen.e: Some research results shows that it is possible to go back further to areas around present Qinghai Province in China.
Some research results show that it is possible to go back further to areas around the present Qinghai Province in China.
Some research results show that it is possible to go back further to areas around the present Qinghai Province in China.

sen.j: 稲作については、弥生米のDNA（SSR多型）分析によって、朝鮮半島には存在しない水稲の品種が確認されており、朝鮮半島経由のルートとは異なる、中国中南部から直接渡来したルートが提唱されている。
sen.e: As for rice cultivation, DNA (SSR polymorphism) analysis of Yayoi rice confirmed a paddy-rice variety that does not exist in Korean Peninsula and theory of direct introduction route from central and south China is proposed, not a route through Korean Peninsula.

As for rice cultivation, DNA (SSR polymorphism) analysis of Yayoi rice confirmed a paddy-rice variety that does not exist on the Korean Peninsula and theory of a direct introduction route from central and south China is proposed, not a route through the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: また近年、渡来系弥生人のDNAとお酒に弱い人の遺伝子の関連性が調査されている。
sen.e: Also a relationship between genes from a person who cannot drink much alcohol and DNA of Yayoi man who was a immigrants to ancient Japan has been researched in recent years.
Also a relationship between genes from a person who cannot drink much alcohol and DNA of a Yayoi man who was an immigrant to ancient Japan has been researched in recent years.

sen.j: 弥生時代の開始についてはかつて中国の春秋戦国時代の混乱と関連付ける考えがあった。
sen.e: There used to be a theory that related the beginning of Yayoi period with disturbance of the Spring and Autumn period and the Warring States period in China.

sen.j: しかし弥生時代の開始年代を繰り上げる説に関連してこれを否定するか、あるいは殷から周への政変に関連付ける考えが検討されるようになった。
sen.e: However, in connection with a theory to moving up the beginning date of Yayoi period, whether or not to reject the previous theory, or to relate new date with political changes of Yin Dynasty to Zhou Dynasty have been considered.

sen.j: 中国の史書では、後漢の『論衡』が周代の倭に関する知識を伝え、ついで漢書が前漢代のこととして倭人が多数の国に分かれて住んでおり、使節を送ってくると記している。

sen.j: しかし、これらの人骨資料のほとんどは、北部九州・山口・島根県の日本海沿岸にかけての遺跡から発掘されたものである。
sen.e: However, most of these human bone materials were excavated from sites in the coastal areas of Sea of Japan, including northern Kyushu, Yamaguchi and Shimane Prefecture.
However, most of these human bone materials were excavated from sites in the coastal areas of the Sea of Japan, including northern Kyushu, Yamaguchi, and Shimane Prefecture.
However, most of these human bone materials were excavated from sites in the coastal areas of the Sea of Japan, including northern Kyushu, Yamaguchi, and Shimane Prefectures.

sen.j: 近年、福岡県糸島半島の新町遺跡で大陸墓制である支石墓から発見された人骨は縄文的習俗である抜歯が施されていた。
sen.e: Recently a human bone was excavated from shisekibo (a dolmen), which is a continental burial system, in Shinmachi site in Itoshima Peninsula, Fukuoka Prefecture, and tooth extraction had been performed to the human bone, which was a manners and customs of Jomon.

Recently a human bone was excavated from shisekibo (a dolmen), which is a continental burial system, in Shinmachi site in Itoshima Peninsula, Fukuoka Prefecture, and tooth extraction had been performed to the human bone, that was the manner and custom of Jomon.

Recently a human bone was excavated from shisekibo (a dolmen), which is a continental burial system, in Shinmachi site in Itoshima Peninsula, Fukuoka Prefecture, and tooth extraction had been performed to the human bone, that was the manner and custom of Jomon.

sen.j: 長崎県大友遺跡の支石墓群から多くの縄文的な人骨が発見されている。
sen.e: Many of Jomon like human bones were excavated from group of shisekibo in Otomo site in Nagasaki Prefecture.
Many of Jomon like human bones were excavated from a group of shisekibo at the Otomo site in Nagasaki Prefecture.
Many of Jomon like human bones were excavated from a group of shisekibo at the Otomo site in Nagasaki Prefecture.

sen.j: さらに瀬戸内地方の神戸市新方遺跡からの人骨も縄文的形質を備えているという。
sen.e: Moreover, human bones excavated from Shinpo site located in Kobe City in Setouchi region also showed some Jomon characteristics.
Moreover, human bones excavated from the Shinpo site located in Kobe City in the Setouchi region also showed some Jomon characteristics.
Moreover, human bones excavated from the Shinpo site located in Kobe City in the Setouchi region also showed some Jomon characteristics.

sen.j: ただ、福岡市の雀居（ささい）遺跡や奈良盆地の唐古・鍵遺跡の前期弥生人は、渡来系の人骨だと判定されている。
sen.e: However, earlier period Yayoi man excavated from Sasai site in Fukuoka City and Karako-Kagi site in Nara Basin was confirmed as bones of immigrants to ancient Japan.
However, earlier period Yayoi man excavated from the Sasai site in Fukuoka City and the Karako-Kagi site in the Nara Basin was confirmed as bones of immigrants to ancient Japan.
However, earlier period Yayoi men excavated from the Sasai site in Fukuoka City and the Karako-Kagi site in the Nara Basin were confirmed as bones of immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: つまり、最初に渡来人が来たと考えられている北部九州や大陸系渡来人が移住した可能性のある瀬戸内・近畿地方でさえ、弥生時代初期の遺跡からは渡来系の人と判定される人骨の出土数は少ない。
sen.e: In other word, excavated number of human bones confirmed as immigrants to ancient Japan are very rare in sites from early Yayoi period, even in northern Kyushu where it is said immigrants to ancient Japan first entered, and in Setouchi and Kinki region where it is believed continental immigrants to ancient Japan migrated.

In other words, the number of excavated human bones confirmed as immigrants to ancient Japan are very rare in sites from the early Yayoi period, even in northern Kyushu where it is said immigrants to ancient Japan first entered, and in the Setouchi and Kinki region where it is believed continental immigrants to ancient Japan migrated.

In other words, the number of excavated human bones confirmed as immigrants to ancient Japan are very rare in sites from the early Yayoi period, even in northern Kyushu where it is said immigrants to ancient Japan first entered, and in the Setouchi and Kinki region where it is believed continental immigrants to ancient Japan migrated.

sen.j: 水田稲作の先進地帯でも、渡来系の人々ではなく、縄文人が水稲耕作を行ったのではないか。
sen.e: Jomon man may have started paddy-rice cultivation in area of advanced paddy-rice cultivation, not immigrants to ancient Japan.
Jomon man may have started rice-paddy cultivation in area of advanced rice-paddy cultivation, not the immigrants to ancient Japan.
Jomon man may have started rice-paddy cultivation in area of advanced rice-paddy cultivation, not the immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 絶対多数の縄文人と少数の大陸系渡来人との協同のうちに農耕社会へと移行したと考えられる。
sen.e: It is believed that history moved to agrarian society in cooperation between Jomon man of an absolute majority and few continental immigrants to ancient Japan.
It is believed that history moved to an agrarian society in cooperation between Jomon man of an absolute majority and few continental immigrants to ancient Japan.
It is believed that history moved to an agrarian society in cooperation between Jomon man of an absolute majority and few continental immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 現代の遺跡発掘調査
sen.e: Present excavation and research of sites
Present excavation and research of sites

sen.j: 熊本県玉名市の両迫間日渡（りょうはざまひわたし）遺跡で、弥生時代後期のものとみられる水田跡の一部が発見された。
sen.e: A part of paddy field remains from the end of Yayoi period was discovered in Ryohazamahiwata site in Tamana City, Kumamoto Prefecture.
Part of paddy field remains from the end of Yayoi period was discovered in Ryohazamahiwata site in Tamana City, Kumamoto Prefecture.

sen.j: あぜ道（約幅1メートル）には土の流失を防ぐため多数の杭が打ち込まれており、足跡も約50カ所見つかっている。
sen.e: Many stakes were put up at side of a path (approximately 1 meter width) between paddy field to stop soil from being carried out, and about 50 foot prints are also found.

sen.j: あぜ道からは土器片や割れた木製の鍬などが見つかっている。
sen.e: Fragments of earthware and broken wooden hoe were excavated from a path between paddy field.
Fragments of earthenware and a broken wooden hoe were excavated from a path between paddy fields.
